data.title: William Mckinley Accomplishments - 1107 Words
data.meta_description: Free Essay: William Mckinley was elected as the 25th President of the United States on March 4th, 1897(Israel 89). He was very successful, having many...
data.text:
William Mckinley was elected as the 25th President of the United States on March 4th, 1897(Israel 89). He was very successful, having many accomplishments as president, including leading America in the Spanish-American War(Andrews). One of his biggest impacts was the raising of tariffs to promote American industry(Andrews). Many people were starting to throw their support behind Mckinley, making him a very popular man. Everything looked like it was going well for the President. With his popularity and success in his first term, he earned himself one more, but after a short six months into his second term, his time as president would be over. Everything ended for Mckinley on September 14, 1901, when he passed away a week after being shot by Leon Czolgosz(Andrews). William Mckinley gave his last speech at the Pan-American Exposition in Buffalo, …show more content…

He had many accomplishments as president, including striving to bring the North and the South together as one strong nation and leading America to a victory in the Spanish-American war in 1898. Mckinley was on his way to becoming a president that would be known for his impact on the United States for years to come. However, this all came to an end when he was shot by Leon Czolgosz in 1901. Czolgosz was a troubled man who had beliefs that lead him to kill the President. His part in an anarchist organization helped influence the decision as well. Thanks to a man in the crowd Mckinley did not die right away. He lived for a short while, before dying in his sleep a week later after continually losing consciousness(Andrews). Moreover, Czolgosz plead guilty to the murder of the President and was sentenced to death by electric chair. The world mourned the President’s death for weeks after he was assassinated. All in all William Mckinley was a president on his way to becoming great before being stopped in his tracks by a young man and his thoughts on people leading
